title: Dear Riot: Remember Why you nerfed Zed Last year?
body:
Yeah, remember that? His mobility!

So he would have to make meaningful choices about going in and not just dance all over the place with very little risk to his plays.

I thought I'd remind you, since you pretty much just 180° the guy to the original state that made you nerf him in the first place.
Or you didn't notice? Or wait... it's on purpose, isn't it?

replies.body:
Zed is such a pain in the ass to balance and he's absolutely NOT the posterchild for a 'healthy assassin'

He's not supposed to be an easy champ to play but god damn if his laning phase isn't a stroll through a god damn meadow considering just about every other midlaner has _actual problems_ that they need to work around

His number one problem is when his opponent takes 6 years to build zhonya's or sacrifices every other necessary stat to build QSS.

Boo fucking hoo.

What Assassin do you consider healthy then? Talon? If he is ahead of you he will 100-0 you every time you walk into his lane. Akali? Definition of a stat checker. LeBlanc? Same issues as Zed. Diana? Also a stat checker. Rengar and Kha'zix are damn near impossible to balance because they are either trash tier or 100-0 you in under a second as there seems to be no middle ground with them. Like if you are going to say Zed isn't a healthy assassin then what do you consider one that IS healthy since the rest of the roster is much worse than Zed when they are at their prime.

Assassins should 100-0 people. It's the circumstances in which they do so or the extra effects that matter.

Zed? 100-0's people in plain sight of their allies. And he can press R to undo his in-the-middle-of-the-whole-enemy-team predicament. Also he has the safest early game of any champion. Low risk high reward playstyle. Not healthy at all.

Talon? 100-0's the target only if noone peels. Also deals massive AoE and doesn't have a reliable out to his in. Also has a terrible laning phase. Healthy.

Diana? 100-0's people in plain sight but hers is far more telegraphed than any other (while not turning untargetable like Zed). Has a mediocre laning phase.

Rengar? Fuck no, nerf it. Thnx Riot.

Akali? Fuck no too, rework it. Thnx again Riot.

Kha'Zix? Potentially healthy but currently kept in an undertuned state for whatever reason. His 100-0 requires isolation -- something that Riot has determined is the length of a football field.

+1 for the kha'zix info

so true

He also forgot Katarina, which IMO is a totally health champ.

She has to kill someone when she goes in in order to get an escape out and needs to know when to go in or she gets blown up.

I think the only issue with Kat is that she can turn a single kill into a penta because not only can she escape but suddenly she can damage again too.

Not saying she doesn't have counterplay, just saying it's annoying that an assassin turns into a mobile low range burst mage.

Kat really relies on going in when your entire team is low; that is what makes her scary. Sure, you get those Katarna's that 100-0 your ADC because he is fed AF, but if your mid laner can handle her during laning, and your bot lane has good map awareness, she is pretty healthy to play against.
You forgot yasou, ekko & fizz

Yas - Easy to counter with an all in meele mid or a person with stun (annie is his nightmare). Yes, he destroys most straight line skill shot mid champs, but that's his niche. His laning phase is weak as long as you pick someone that can bully him. 

Ekko - His mana costs keep him in check, and as long as you don't do something stupid, I.E chase him into the Jungle, you can generally force him to burn his ult defensively, not offensively. Zed can do both at the same time. 

Fizz - yea I hate this prick, no argument here.
My problem with Yasuo isn't that he's overpowered, It's that he's annoying, I make a point of banning him every game because I just don't want to deal with his shit.

> And he can press R to undo his in-the-middle-of-the-whole-enemy-team predicament.

This particular scenario is the fault of the enemy team. If I see Zed ulting into the middle of our team, I'm going to have a surprise ready the moment he appears.
I still agree that Zed is 12 shades of BS.

Talon agree.

Diana's issue is that she wasn't originally meant to be an assassin. When she gets ahead, she is not a glass cannon like other assassins. She also doesn't play the positioning game that assassins do, she just picks a direction and rips everything in her was a new ass hole. She's actually closer to Riven.
I'm not claiming she is or isn't healthy per say. But her assassins status is a design *flaw*.

Rengar Agree.

Akali has the worst lane phase of the group. Worse than even Kha'Zix right now. And her "out" (fog bubble), isn't very reliable against competent opponents who either sweeper/pink ward it or drop AoE on her head.

Once upon a time, Kha'Zix did the same things Rengar did. Appeared out of nowhere, blew someone up, then ran away at high speed. Thank Morello they nerfed the crap out of that (hint hint, Riot). Though to be fair, I think he has better levers than most assassins between his 2 passives (isolation *and* bonus damage when not seen).
Totally agree, and if Diana uses her only mobility to all in, she has no escapes.

If Zed R's into the  middle of the enemy team and no one CC's him, then your team is at fault.

He even gives you a second to set up right where he is about to reappear

>What Assassin do you consider healthy then?

Believe it or not 

{{champion:35}} 


He is high risk, high reward.

Playing a good Shaco isn't about being amazing at combos (most LoL 'assassins' are mobile burst mages), but rather excellent judgement and decision making. That is, he feels like an assassin, cunning and sneaky.


He can take out one target in an instant, but struggles when locked down by a team

Punishes carelessness on the other team and is punished by his own carelessness.


His Q is fair since he can either use it to go in for a kill or escape a dangerous situation, not both

Riot has difficulty creating assassins that are actually healthy because Riot usually breaks their own definition on what an assassin is. "High risk, high reward". Pretty sure most assassins in the game are so mobile that they're some of the safest champions you could ever play like Zed, and the rest don't even need to be fed and can literally kill you in 1/10th of a second.

 I think Talon is the closest thing in the game to a healthy assassin but even he has some glaring issues. I don't think a "healthy assassin" is actually possible to exist in a game that revolves around skill. An assassin either will instakill your carry simply because their entire team wasn't protecting them all at once, or they will do nothing of importance and be irrelevant to the team. Assassins in League are fundamentally flawed.
+1000 this anti Zed circlejerk in here is so fucking dumb. The other assasins have been far more problematic than Zed ever was.

In this community every assassin is considered unhealthy and most of the time is cause ppl dont know how to play against them! An assassin should be an high risk high reward champ, u get fed-->carry, u fall behind -> 4v5. For me its fine like this, but then ppl let rengar powerfarm till 6 with no counter jungling , dont buy pinks and then are surprised he can one shot...riot nerfed rengo, it will nerf zed and thr cycle will continue. Every season there s an assassin that has to be nerfed to the ground and become unplayable for a while. (Se kha in s4 and look at him in s5)

Ps. Lil biased on rengo since is my main..but CMON!

Alright man, I can kinda see where you are coming from, but you need to work on your argument. Work on your spacing, your words seem to just smash together. Make sure you spell your words properly, it really helps you seem more professional. 

And for your counter play of Rengar, you should know that even when falling behind slightly, Rengar still poses a massive threat to any squishy because he can just pick up a kill after a team fight with his ult. AssassinÂ´s are very good at returning from a poor early game, simply because their targets do not build defensive items often, so when the assassin gets enough stats to kill them, they can just kill them.

4th lowest winrate in game.  Felt clunky as all hell.  "I think Zed was balanced :DDD!"

And i thought you meant recently, because 5.22 isnt really relevant. Zed didnt become overbearing during S5. >I thought zed was perfectly balanced before his w buffs

This is the reason Zed was buffed, he was shit tier and received buffs. Zeds problem was he was extremely clunky, item interactions and masteries dont fix clunky and impossible to play.  Do you get what I am saying now?

5.22 is preseason btw, its not too far off.  The guy is saying Zed was balanced while he had the 4th lowest winrate in the game.

OK - youve done this a couple times now. Winrate doesnt mean "balanced" or not. Lets get that clear. So you can keep saying he has a low winrate, but that doesnt mean he was balanced. Are you telling me that Illaoi is balanced? Tahm is balanced? Ryze? Rengar? Lee Sin? Because all these champions dont have a good winrate. So  following your logic, that means we need Illaoi, Tahm, Ryze, Rengar, and Lee Sin buffed, right? 

Secondly, patches with changes arent always indicative of a champions power. For example, the previous (pre 5.22) build was wildly different and a lot weaker, but I'm sure people on 5.22 still build those items. Similarly. Zed's winrate skyrocketed from 5.23 (when the shadow changes were implemented) to 5.24 (no significant changes). What explains that? Maybe people getting used to the massive amount of changes that were made? 

He was buffed in 5.23, and his winrate is steadily rising, suggesting that people are figuring out his power, and is one of the most picked mids. I still stand by the other guy's point - they should have waited to see Zed's interactions with items before buffing him.

His winrate rose because he received buffs to his w that made him feel less clunky and more playable.  I feel like you have an inability to read or something.  You don't go from an average 48% winrate to a 42% winrate in a day, that isn't normal.  That means the champion just got fucking destroyed by a nerf.  Is that actually hard to understand?

Zed pre-buff: 42% winrate
Tahm :48%
Rengar: 45% (receiving buffs)
Lee Sin: 45% (he is just a hard champion, it takes like 300+ games to actually be decent with him, and if you aren't good with him you are dead weight.)
Ryze: 48%

**Is this shit actually hard for you to understand or are you just being stubborn?**

Tahm and Ryze are both their own 50 shades of bullshit but their average games for playerbase is extremely low, a sign of most of the ppl playing them barelly playing them at all.  Once their players get a couple games their winrates become absolute bullshit (especially Ryze).  Zeds average games for playerbase is in the 100s and was even with his ridiculously high playrate, that shows a very dedicated playerbase, and this is the explanation for low winrates on bullshit champs.  Zed has always had a very high average games for playerbase even with his garbage winrate, FACE IT Zed was trash and needed buffs.

Youmuus/Cleaver/Maw/Bork/Hydra/Mercurial/LastWhisper/Bloodthirster its always been situational and hasn't changed in the slightest.  The only changes that were made is that his shadow wasn't garbage anymore and people got used to the new feel on his shadow.

I will stand by my point, he was fucking gutted and needed buffs, he was not in a good position at all.  Anyone who says

is actually just dumb.

And Zed's games played doesnt necessarily mean that Zed has a dedicated playerbase. Actually, in light of his pickrate, id say he is just played by freelo abusers. Heimerdinger had a dedicated playerbase - one of the lowest picks, but managed an amazing winrate. Having a good winrate and a high pickrate just means he is strong. You dont need to be amazing mechanically when you can Ult-E-Q-(Ghostblade)-Auto a few times and be able to kill tanks.

My main problem with Zed is that he can be played way too safe during laning phase. Other melee assassins have to calculate the risk for almost every single minion they want to lasthit. Zed's got his Q and if his Q isn't enough or even that is too risky to use he can use his shadow so he can get cs with his E as well or just clear the wave pretty damn fast. Besides that his shadow is an incredible zoning tool, especially since most mid laners he faces don't too good defensive stats/abilities or health sustain.
He just farms to the point where he thinks he can kill you and then goes in while still being pretty safe for his engages duration.

If Zed was nerfed in a way so he would have to commit to lasthitting or staying healthy in the early game I wouldn't even mind if he'd have a stronger powerspike after that, but right now it's hilarious how safe he can be played while still not falling behind and forcing lots of mid-laners into rushing Zhonya's.

It's not even that I've got massive problems with Zed, but that's more because of the champions I play and not because of Zed himself.

More risk, more reward.

I mean most mages play it safe during laning phase too. Look at {{champion:99}} who just farms under tower/off screen all game until her jungler ganks. And unlike Zed she has strong teamfight, insane late game, and can actually do something if she doesn't have kills.

That's right, but if she just misses her Q in a critical situation she'll be most likely dead against more or less mobile champs or champs with a strong lockdown. Zed is vulnerable to such lockdowns too, but he has the ability to assassinate most mages and immobile squishies extremely fast and even if he makes a horrendous mistake or misses most of his damage he can still get out of the fight in almost any situation.
Champs like Fizz can do the same, but their area of action is way smaller and if he fails to kill his target there's still a good chance to get him. Zed has a shadow out of your towers range, follows and attacks you until you reach your second turret and he'll still get out most of the time.
Dunno...it just feels kinda wrong in many situations.
The point is that zed main assassination tool (ultimate) is super easy to counter. Qss or zonia and you make his ultimate useless on you. I think this is the tradeoff for his "easier" lane phase.

The only Zed nerfs I could recall was because of his split pushing power.

His Death Mark was nerfed to have a 1 second delay, but realistically it only comes into play if W is on cool down when Zed ults. Otherwise, if Zed needs an instant escape, he can always throw out his W first, press R, then switch back to W.

Zed's biggest nerf last year was to his AS. It is currently around ~2/3 of his original value at level 18 because he was too strong at taking towers as a split pusher.

For a long time he remained a mediocre pick. He is only popular now because he is one of the few AD assassins who can proc TL from range. Even with his mobility, he had ~45% win rate before TL was introduced.

If anything, Zed needs a damage nerf, which is why Riot reduced his Death Mark damage scaling.
Zed is a bit too strong atm, probably because of thunderlords.

ironically, so far the whole "lets make everyone a snowball king, and make winning or losing early game team fights super important!" has lead to the most boring LCS i've seen so far, because players are even MORE terrified of losing an early team fight, since it's so snowbally now. Teams don't want those early fights, because they know how much losing them and giving a assassin/adc 2 kills will hurt them. 

Games now are pretty much even worse farm fests, and with the lack of vision, everyone plays super, super safe. LCS right now is "who after 6 will hit the first successful gank mid or bot, and then play safe as hell and farm to protect that snowball?"

I mean, teams are now pretty much as a rule conceding bot and top towers just to get a safer lanning phase/ early trade on global gold.  That's always been a strategy teams do of course, but now it's pretty much just expected. For all the "strategy" involved, the pro games should just start with a tower down in each lane and the teams awarded the global gold.

Riot is the one who finds it boring I happen to enjoy strategic games a lot.

The current games have devolved into watching two teams stall and farm for 20 minutes then go ham for 5. Its pretty boring now to watch even Korean LoL as even the casters complain about it.
